subject: Re: Re : [EVP-ITC] Proofs for spirit world?
author: John Frick
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0070_01C94581.52705100
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

This conversation has gone in a wild direction. It would be impossible to p=
rove that a ghost can fit into a microwave, just as it would be impossible =
to prove that the ghost could even get into the room that housed the microw=
ave. The likely fact is that whatever the ghosts are, they are not really c=
oming here into our 3d world at all when they put their voices on, or influ=
ence our recordings, this is obviously all done extra-dimensionally. Certai=
nly we can know for sure that ghosts do not have 3 dimensional bodies, and =
so do not exist in 3 dimensional space (where our rooms and microwaves exis=
t). Obviously they exist only in higher dimensions, maybe even outside of 1=
1 dimensional space altogether. Who knows?



  ----- Original Message ----=
- 
  From: David Koenig 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, N=
ovember 13, 2008 9:53 AM
  Subject: Re: Re : [EVP-ITC] Proofs for spirit wo=
rld?


  No. I'm only saying that claiming that any or all Spirits can fit =
in a Microwave Box is not necessarily so.

  You have an assumption. Where =
is the reasoning behind it?


  On Thu, Nov 13, 2008 at 9:34 AM, threadsint=
yme@... <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:


    What makes you think tha=
t I haven't used the same principals?

    Please keep in mind that *my* ex=
periences are vastly different from others experience.  Very few people hav=
e had the exactly same experiences. Those are my experiences.  Your experie=
nces are *your* experiences.

    Our experiences (even though they may dif=
fer) are still legitimate experiences. I am not willing to say that just be=
cause someone's experiences are diferent than mine they are not legitimate.=


    Are you prepared to argue that others experiences are not legitimate =
just because they may challenge your own views? 

    Al

    -- "David Koe=
nig" <floridajakeblues@...> wrote:


    Well AL 



    I don't clai=
m to have all the answers. In my world "I don't have to be right."


    If=
 you have all of the answers "For Sure" then thanks for sharing. It will sa=
ve me a lot of critical thinking.


    Otherwise I will continue to use th=
e Scientific methods of reason and observation.


    On Thu, Nov 13, 2008 =
at 7:58 AM, threadsintyme@... <Threadsintyme@...> wrote:


      =
Why is it so difficult for you to believe that Spirits are not able to move=
 between dimensions, walk through solid walls, doors, etc? If a spirits can=
 move between dimensions walking through a solid core door would be simple!=
 

      What is your proof? I have seen spirits go straight through solid =
core doors. Walls, etc.

      What do YOU know for sure about the spirit w=
orld, David Koenig? 

      Al

      -- "David Koenig" <floridajakeblues@g=
mail.com> wrote:


      There are a few things that I can do as a Human...=
. But I Can't fit into a microwave oven. What would make you think that a S=
pirit could... or Would? Is that covered in Spirit 101 somewhere and I miss=
ed it? 

      Some Spirits can tell the future. Others can't. Some don't e=
ven know they've passed on. Others do.
      I'd like to hear everyones exp=
ertise in the Spirit World.
      What do you know for sure?


      On Wed=
, Nov 12, 2008 at 10:59 PM, Zack Widup <w9sz@...> wrote:


     =
   Well, that always brings up the question - why couldn't they?



       =
 Zack

        On Wed, 12 Nov 2008, David Koenig wrote:


        > I'm not=
 convinced that Spirits have all of the abilities that you allude to.
     =
   > How do you know what the Can and Can't do?I do not believe all Spirits=
 have
        > the same abilities. I don't believe they are omnipresent.
 =
       > How can you be sure that they can get into a microwave?
        >
=
        > On Wed, Nov 12, 2008 at 9:10 AM, threadsintyme@... <
       =
 > Threadsintyme@...> wrote:
        >
        >> What makes you think=
 they aren't able to do as I have described?
        >>
        >> From wha=
t you are assuming is that spirits must have coporeal bodies. They
        =
>> don't. They are pure spirit. That means they ain't got no body.
        =
>>
        >> Al
        >>
        >>
        >> -- "David Koenig" <florid=
ajakeblues@...> wrote:
        >>
        >> And how would you know t=
hat for sure? You seem to be assuming that
        >> Spirits have God-like=
 superpowers. How would you know this?
        >>
        >> On Tue, Nov 11=
, 2008 at 3:49 PM, threadsintyme@... <
        >> Threadsintyme@juno.c=
om> wrote:
        >>
        >>> Spirits are made up on non-coporeal matte=
r. means "they ain't got no
        >>> body!" Means they can show up anywh=
ere's at anytime.
        >>>
        >>> Al
        >>>
        >>>
      =
  >>> -- Bagheera BL <bagheerabl@...> wrote:
        >>>
        >>> I=
f they can't fit in, try with a plunger!
        >>>
        >>> Joke aside=
, it's the theory. They must be in the oven.... but (there's
        >>> al=
ways a but), with the many dimensions, what's a specific place for us
     =
   >>> might not be the same for them. So little we know, so much left to
 =
       >>> understand.
        >>>
        >>> ----------------------------=
--
        >>> *De :* David Koenig <floridajakeblues@...>
        >>>=
 **

        >>> *Envoy=C3(c) le :* dimanche 9 novembre 2008, 20 h 44 min 5=
0 s 

        >>> **
        >>> So the spirit must somehow get into the mi=
crowave?
        >>>
        >>> On Sun, Nov 9, 2008 at 3:36 PM, Bagheera B=
L <bagheerabl@...> wrote:
        >>>
        >>>> Hi Al,
        >>>>=
 if the spirits modulates or radiates from within the cage, the signal
    =
    >>>> will "come through", with the bonus of some kind of a proof.
     =

        >>>> Vincent Rodrigue
